GO:0002347.name: response to tumor cell
GO:0002347.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a tumor cell.

GO:0002357.name: defense response to tumor cell
GO:0002357.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a tumor cell that act to protect the cell or organism.

GO:0002418.name: immune response to tumor cell
GO:0002418.definition: An immune system process that functions in the response of an organism to a tumor cell.

GO:0002423.name: natural killer cell mediated immune response to tumor cell
GO:0002423.definition: An immune response mediated by a natural killer cell triggered in response to the presence of a tumor cell.

GO:0002424.name: T cell mediated immune response to tumor cell
GO:0002424.definition: An immune response mediated by a T cell triggered in response to the presence of a tumor cell.

GO:0002437.name: inflammatory response to antigenic stimulus
GO:0002437.definition: An inflammatory response to an antigenic stimulus, which can be include any number of T cell or B cell epitopes.

GO:0002438.name: acute inflammatory response to antigenic stimulus
GO:0002438.definition: An acute inflammatory response to an antigenic stimulus. An acute inflammatory response occurs within a matter of minutes or hours, and either resolves within a few days or becomes a chronic inflammatory response.

GO:0002439.name: chronic inflammatory response to antigenic stimulus
GO:0002439.definition: A chronic inflammatory response to an antigenic stimulus. A chronic inflammatory response persists indefinitely during days, weeks, or months in the life of an individual.

GO:0002525.name: acute inflammatory response to non-antigenic stimulus
GO:0002525.definition: An acute inflammatory response to non-antigenic stimuli such as heat or physical trauma.

GO:0002545.name: chronic inflammatory response to non-antigenic stimulus
GO:0002545.definition: A chronic inflammatory response to a non-antigenic stimulus such as heat or physical trauma.

GO:0006950.name: response to stress
synonyms: response to biotic stress
response to abiotic stress
GO:0006950.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a disturbance in organismal or cellular homeostasis, usually, but not necessarily, exogenous (e.g. temperature, humidity, ionizing radiation).

GO:0006974.name: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
synonyms: cellular DNA damage response
response to genotoxic stress
response to DNA damage stimulus
DNA damage response
GO:0006974.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating damage to its DNA from environmental insults or errors during metabolism.

GO:0006979.name: response to oxidative stress
GO:0006979.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of oxidative stress, a state often resulting from exposure to high levels of reactive oxygen species, e.g. superoxide anions, hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), and hydroxyl radicals.

GO:0006991.name: response to sterol depletion
synonyms: sterol depletion response
GO:0006991.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating deprivation of sterols. Sterols are a group of steroids characterized by the presence of one or more hydroxyl groups and a hydrocarbon side-chain in the molecule.

GO:0006995.name: cellular response to nitrogen starvation
GO:0006995.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of nitrogen.

GO:0003042.name: vasoconstriction of artery involved in carotid body chemoreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
synonyms: vasoconstriction of artery during carotid body chemoreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0003042.definition: A process that is triggered by carotid body-vasomotor excitation and results in a decrease in the diameter of an artery during the chemoreceptor response to decreased blood pressure.

GO:0003043.name: vasoconstriction of artery involved in aortic body chemoreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
synonyms: vasoconstriction of artery during aortic body chemoreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0003043.definition: A process that is triggered by aortic body-vasomotor excitation and results in a decrease in the diameter of an artery during the chemoreceptor response to decreased blood pressure.

GO:0003299.name: muscle hypertrophy in response to stress
GO:0003299.definition: The enlargement or overgrowth of all or part of a muscle organ or tissue due to an increase in the size of its muscle cells as a result of a disturbance in organismal or cellular homeostasis.

GO:0007541.name: sex determination, primary response to X:A ratio
GO:0007541.definition: The developmental process in which an organism interprets its X to autosomal chromosomal complement.

GO:0009605.name: response to external stimulus
synonyms: response to environmental stimulus
GO:0009605.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an external stimulus.

GO:0009607.name: response to biotic stimulus
synonyms: response to biotic stress
GO:0009607.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a biotic stimulus, a stimulus caused or produced by a living organism.

GO:0009608.name: response to symbiont
synonyms: response of host to symbiont
GO:0009608.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a symbiont, an organism living with an organism of a different species in close physical association. The symbiont is defined as the smaller of the organisms involved in a symbiotic interaction.

GO:0009609.name: response to symbiotic bacterium
synonyms: response to symbiotic bacteria
GO:0009609.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a symbiotic bacterium, a bacterium living in close physical association with another organism.

GO:0009610.name: response to symbiotic fungus
synonyms: response to symbiotic fungi
GO:0009610.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a symbiotic fungus, a fungus living in close physical association with another organism.

GO:0009611.name: response to wounding
synonyms: physiological response to wounding
GO:0009611.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating damage to the organism.

GO:0009615.name: response to virus
synonyms: response to viruses
GO:0009615.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a virus.

GO:0009617.name: response to bacterium
synonyms: response to bacteria
GO:0009617.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a bacterium.

GO:0009620.name: response to fungus
synonyms: response to fungi
GO:0009620.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a fungus.

GO:0009624.name: response to nematode
synonyms: response to nematodes
GO:0009624.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a nematode.

GO:0009719.name: response to endogenous stimulus
GO:0009719.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus arising within the organism.

GO:0008630.name: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to DNA damage
synonyms: DNA damage response, signal transduction resulting in induction of apoptosis
GO:0008630.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a cell. The pathway is induced by the detection of DNA damage, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered.

GO:0008631.name: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to oxidative stress
synonyms: induction of apoptosis by oxidative stress
oxidative stress-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
GO:0008631.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a cell. The pathway is induced in response to oxidative stress, a state often resulting from exposure to high levels of reactive oxygen species, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered.

GO:0014823.name: response to activity
synonyms: response to exercise
GO:0014823.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an activity stimulus.

GO:0014850.name: response to muscle activity
GO:0014850.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a muscle activity stimulus.

GO:0014854.name: response to inactivity
GO:0014854.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an inactivity stimulus.

GO:0014870.name: response to muscle inactivity
GO:0014870.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a muscle inactivity stimulus.

GO:0014898.name: cardiac muscle hypertrophy in response to stress
GO:0014898.definition: The physiological enlargement or overgrowth of all or part of the heart muscle due to an increase in size (not length) of individual cardiac muscle fibers, without cell division, as a result of a disturbance in organismal or cellular homeostasis.

GO:0009267.name: cellular response to starvation
GO:0009267.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of nourishment.

GO:0009970.name: cellular response to sulfate starvation
synonyms: cellular response to sulphate starvation
GO:0009970.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of sulfate.

GO:0009991.name: response to extracellular stimulus
GO:0009991.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an extracellular stimulus.

GO:0010106.name: cellular response to iron ion starvation
GO:0010106.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of iron ions.

GO:0010350.name: cellular response to magnesium starvation
GO:0010350.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of magnesium.

GO:0010438.name: cellular response to sulfur starvation
GO:0010438.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of sulfur.

GO:0031667.name: response to nutrient levels
GO:0031667.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus reflecting the presence, absence, or concentration of nutrients.

GO:0031668.name: cellular response to extracellular stimulus
GO:0031668.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an extracellular stimulus.

GO:0031669.name: cellular response to nutrient levels
GO:0031669.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus reflecting the presence, absence, or concentration of nutrients.

GO:0000754.name: adaptation of signaling pathway by response to pheromone involved in conjugation with cellular fusion
synonyms: adaptation to pheromone during conjugation with cellular fusion
desensitization to pheromone during conjugation with cellular fusion
adaptation of signalling pathway by response to pheromone involved in conjugation with cellular fusion
GO:0000754.definition: In organisms that undergo conjugation with cellular fusion, the process resulting in desensitization following exposure to pheromone stimulus that act to down-regulate further stimulation or block initial conjugation responses. An example of this is the adaptation to pheromone during conjugation with cellular fusion in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

GO:0001403.name: invasive growth in response to glucose limitation
synonyms: colony morphology
GO:0001403.definition: A growth pattern exhibited by budding haploid cells under certain growth conditions, in which cells retain the typical axial budding pattern of haploids, but become elongated and fail to separate after division; during growth on a solid substrate, this results in penetration of cells into the agar medium. An example of this process is found in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

GO:0001562.name: response to protozoan
synonyms: resistance to pathogenic protozoa
response to protozoon
response to protozoa
GO:0001562.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a protozoan.

GO:0016036.name: cellular response to phosphate starvation
GO:0016036.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of phosphate.

GO:0034976.name: response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
synonyms: ER stress response
cellular response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
response to ER stress
GO:0034976.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stress acting at the endoplasmic reticulum. ER stress usually results from the accumulation of unfolded or misfolded proteins in the ER lumen.

GO:0033554.name: cellular response to stress
GO:0033554.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating the organism is under stress. The stress is usually, but not necessarily, exogenous (e.g. temperature, humidity, ionizing radiation).

GO:0036223.name: cellular response to adenine starvation
synonyms: cellular response to adenine deprivation
GO:0036223.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of adenine.

GO:0036225.name: cellular response to vitamin B1 starvation
synonyms: cellular response to thiamin starvation
cellular response to vitamin B1 deprivation
GO:0036225.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of vitamin B1 (also called thiamin and thiamine).

GO:0036227.name: mitotic G2 cell cycle arrest in response to glucose starvation
GO:0036227.definition: The process in which the mitotic cell cycle is halted during G2 phase as a result of deprivation of glucose.

GO:0036460.name: cellular response to cell envelope stress
synonyms: envelope stress response
GO:0036460.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of stress acting at the cell envelope.

GO:0036473.name: cell death in response to oxidative stress
GO:0036473.definition: Any biological process that results in permanent cessation of all vital functions of a cell upon exposure to an oxidative stress stimulus.

GO:0036474.name: cell death in response to hydrogen peroxide
synonyms: cell death in response to H2O2
hydrogen peroxide-mediated cell death
GO:0036474.definition: Any biological process that results in permanent cessation of all vital functions of a cell upon exposure to hydrogen peroxide (H2O2).

GO:0036475.name: neuron death in response to oxidative stress
synonyms: oxidative stress-induced neuron death
neuronal cell death in response to oxidative stress
GO:0036475.definition: Any biological process that results in permanent cessation of all vital functions of a neuron upon exposure to an oxidative stress stimulus.

GO:0036476.name: neuron death in response to hydrogen peroxide
synonyms: hydrogen peroxide-induced neuron death
neuron death in response to H2O2
neuronal cell death in response to hydrogen peroxide
GO:0036476.definition: Any biological process that results in permanent cessation of all vital functions of a neuron upon exposure to hydrogen peroxide (H2O2).

GO:0036480.name: neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to oxidative stress
synonyms: neuron apoptosis in response to oxidative stress
oxidative stress-induced neuronal apoptosis
oxidative stress-induced neuron apoptosis
GO:0036480.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a neuron. The pathway is induced in response to oxidative stress, a state often resulting from exposure to high levels of reactive oxygen species, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered.

GO:0036481.name: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to hydrogen peroxide
synonyms: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to H2O2
hydrogen peroxide-induced apoptosis
H2O2-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
hydrogen peroxide-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
GO:0036481.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a cell. The pathway is induced in response to hydrogen peroxide (H2O2).

GO:0036482.name: neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to hydrogen peroxide
synonyms: hydrogen peroxide-induced neuron apoptosis
hydrogen peroxide-induced neuronal apoptosis
neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to H2O2
neuron apoptosis in response to hydrogen peroxide
H2O2-induced neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
GO:0036482.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a neuron in response to hydrogen peroxide.

GO:0036483.name: neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
synonyms: endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
ER stress-induced neuron intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway
endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced neuron apoptosis
ER stress-induced neuron apoptosis
GO:0036483.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a neuron. The pathway is induced in response to a stimulus indicating endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered. ER stress usually results from the accumulation of unfolded or misfolded proteins in the ER lumen.

GO:0036492.name: eiF2alpha phosphorylation in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
synonyms: eiF2alpha phosphorylation in response to ER stress
regulation of translation initiation by eiF2alpha phosphorylation in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
GO:0036492.definition: The addition of a phosphate group on to the translation initiation factor eIF2alpha, as a result of endoplasmic reticulum stress.

GO:0001878.name: response to yeast
GO:0001878.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from a yeast species.

GO:0001982.name: baroreceptor response to decreased systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0001982.definition: The lowering of the number of nerve impulses from baroreceptors as a result of decreased stretch of an artery that results in an increased in sympathetic nerve impulses to peripheral blood vessels.

GO:0001983.name: baroreceptor response to increased systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0001983.definition: The increase in nerve impulses from baroreceptors as a result of increased pressure on an artery that results in an inhibition of sympathetic nerve impulses to peripheral blood vessels.

GO:0001984.name: artery vasodilation involved in baroreceptor response to increased systemic arterial blood pressure
synonyms: vasodilation of artery involved in baroreceptor response to increased systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0001984.definition: An increase in the internal diameter of an artery, triggered by vasomotor suppression, during the chemoreceptor response to decreased blood pressure.

GO:0001987.name: vasoconstriction of artery involved in baroreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0001987.definition: A process that is triggered by vasomotor excitation and results in a decrease in the diameter of an artery during the baroreceptor response to decreased blood pressure.

GO:0002012.name: vasoconstriction of artery involved in chemoreceptor response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0002012.definition: A process that is triggered by vasomotor excitation and results in a decrease in the diameter of an artery during the chemoreceptor response to decreased blood pressure.

GO:0002014.name: vasoconstriction of artery involved in ischemic response to lowering of systemic arterial blood pressure
GO:0002014.definition: The vasoconstriction that is triggered by vasomotor excitation resulting from the detection of high carbon dioxide levels in the vasomotor center of the central nervous system.

GO:0002021.name: response to dietary excess
GO:0002021.definition: The physiological process in which dietary excess is sensed by the central nervous system, resulting in a reduction in food intake and increased energy expenditure.

GO:0043207.name: response to external biotic stimulus
GO:0043207.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an external biotic stimulus, an external stimulus caused by, or produced by living things.

GO:0043247.name: telomere maintenance in response to DNA damage
synonyms: DNA damage response, telomere maintenance
GO:0043247.definition: Any process that occur in response to the presence of critically short or damaged telomeres.

GO:0043483.name: anthocyanin biosynthetic process involved in anthocyanin accumulation in response to UV light
synonyms: anthocyanin biosynthesis during anthocyanin accumulation in tissues in response to UV light stimulus
anthocyanin biosynthetic process during anthocyanin accumulation in response to UV light
anthocyanin biosynthetic process during anthocyanin accumulation in tissues in response to UV light stimulus
GO:0043483.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of the pigment anthocyanin, contributing to anthocyanin accumulation in a tissue in response to a UV light stimulus.

GO:0043562.name: cellular response to nitrogen levels
GO:0043562.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus reflecting the presence, absence, or concentration of inorganic nitrogen.

GO:0036497.name: eIF2alpha dephosphorylation in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress

GO:0036497.definition: The removal of a phosphate group from the translation initiation factor eIF2alpha, as a result of endoplasmic reticulum stress.

GO:0042149.name: cellular response to glucose starvation
GO:0042149.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of glucose.

GO:0042221.name: response to chemical

GO:0042221.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a chemical stimulus.

GO:0042594.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a starvation stimulus, deprivation of nourishment.

defence response to bacteria
defence response to bacterium
defense response to bacteria
resistance response to pathogenic bacterium
defense response to bacterium, incompatible interaction
antibacterial peptide activity

GO:0045311.name: invasive growth in response to pheromone
GO:0045311.definition: The growth of colonies in filamentous chains of cells as a result of a pheromone stimulus.

defense response to Gram-negative bacteria
defence response to Gram-negative bacterium
GO:0050829.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a Gram-negative bacterium that act to protect the cell or organism.

defence response to Gram-positive bacteria
defense response to Gram-positive bacteria
Gram-positive antibacterial peptide activity
GO:0050830.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a Gram-positive bacterium that act to protect the cell or organism.

male-specific antibacterial peptide activity
male-specific defense response to bacteria
male-specific defence response to bacteria
GO:0050831.definition: A set of reactions, specific to males, that are triggered in response to the presence of a bacterium that act to protect the cell or organism.

GO:0050832.name: defense response to fungus
synonyms: defence response to fungus

resistance response to pathogenic fungi
defense response to fungus, incompatible interaction
response to parasitic fungi
response to parasitic fungus
resistance response to pathogenic fungus
GO:0050832.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a fungus that act to protect the cell or organism.

GO:0050896.name: response to stimulus

GO:0050896.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus. The process begins with detection of the stimulus and ends with a change in state or activity or the cell or organism.

GO:0035728.name: response to hepatocyte growth factor
synonyms: response to HGF stimulus
response to hepatocyte growth factor stimulus
GO:0035728.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a hepatocyte growth factor stimulus.

GO:0035729.name: cellular response to hepatocyte growth factor stimulus
synonyms: cellular response to HGF stimulus
GO:0035729.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a hepatocyte growth factor stimulus.

GO:0035773.name: insulin secretion involved in cellular response to glucose stimulus
synonyms: insulin secretion involved in cellular response to glucose
GO:0035773.definition: The regulated release of proinsulin from secretory granules (B granules) in the B cells of the pancreas; accompanied by cleavage of proinsulin to form mature insulin, in response to a glucose stimulus.

GO:0042770.name: signal transduction in response to DNA damage
synonyms: DNA damage induced protein phosphorylation
response to DNA damage stimulus by intracellular signaling cascade
DNA damage response, signal transduction
GO:0042770.definition: A cascade of processes induced by the detection of DNA damage within a cell.

GO:0042771.name: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to DNA damage by p53 class mediator
synonyms: DNA damage response, signal transduction by p53 class mediator resulting in induction of apoptosis
GO:0042771.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a cell. The pathway is induced by the cell cycle regulator phosphoprotein p53, or an equivalent protein, in response to the detection of DNA damage, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered.

synonyms: defense response to protozoan, incompatible interaction

GO:0052173.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of detecting the defenses of another organism.

GO:0052201.name: response to symbiont defenses
GO:0052201.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of detecting the defenses of a symbiont organism. The symbiont is defined as the smaller of the organisms involved in a symbiotic interaction.

GO:0051365.name: cellular response to potassium ion starvation
synonyms: cellular response to potassium ion deprivation
cellular response to K+ ion starvation
cellular response to K+ ion deprivation
cellular response to potassium starvation
GO:0051365.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of potassium ions.

GO:0051409.name: response to nitrosative stress
GO:0051409.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a nitrosative stress stimulus. Nitrosative stress is a state often resulting from exposure to high levels of nitric oxide (NO) or the highly reactive oxidant peroxynitrite, which is produced following interaction of NO with superoxide anions.

GO:0051607.name: defense response to virus
synonyms: defence response to virus
antiviral response
defense response to viruses
GO:0051607.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of a virus that act to protect the cell or organism.

GO:0051707.name: response to other organism
GO:0051707.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus from another living organism.

GO:0051716.name: cellular response to stimulus
GO:0051716.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus. The process begins with detection of the stimulus by a cell and ends with a change in state or activity or the cell.

GO:0051775.name: response to redox state
synonyms: redox signal response
GO:0051775.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating redox state. Redox state refers to the balance of oxidized versus reduced forms of electron donors and acceptors in an organelle, cell or organ; plastoquinone, glutathione (GSH/GSSG), and nicotinamide nucleotides (NAD+/NADH and NADP+/NADPH) are among the most important.

GO:0034198.name: cellular response to amino acid starvation
synonyms: general amino acid control response
GAAC response
GO:0034198.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of amino acids.

GO:0034224.name: cellular response to zinc ion starvation
synonyms: cellular response to zinc ion limitation
cellular response to zinc starvation
GO:0034224.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of zinc ions.

GO:0034405.name: response to fluid shear stress
GO:0034405.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a fluid shear stress stimulus. Fluid shear stress is the force acting on an object in a system where the fluid is moving across a solid surface.

GO:0034616.name: response to laminar fluid shear stress
GO:0034616.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a laminar fluid shear stress stimulus. Laminar fluid flow is the force acting on an object in a system where the fluid is moving across a solid surface in parallel layers. As an example, laminar shear stress can be seen where blood flows against the luminal side of blood vessel walls.

GO:0070059.name: intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
synonyms: endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced apoptosis
intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway induced by endoplasmic reticulum stress
apoptosis triggered by ER stress
ER stress-induced apoptosis
apoptosis in response to ER stress
apoptosis in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress
GO:0070059.definition: The series of molecular signals in which an intracellular signal is conveyed to trigger the apoptotic death of a cell. The pathway is induced in response to a stimulus indicating endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress, and ends when the execution phase of apoptosis is triggered. ER stress usually results from the accumulation of unfolded or misfolded proteins in the ER lumen.

GO:0043617.name: cellular response to sucrose starvation
GO:0043617.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of sucrose.

GO:0060275.name: maintenance of stationary phase in response to starvation
GO:0060275.definition: The homeostatic process in which a population of cells changes its metabolic activity resulting in the rate of death in the population equaling the rate of reproduction in response to limited nutrients in the environment.

GO:0060276.name: maintenance of stationary phase in response to toxin
GO:0060276.definition: The homeostatic process in which a population of cells changes its metabolic activity resulting in the rate of death in the population equaling the rate of reproduction in response to a build-up of toxins in the environment.

GO:0035874.name: cellular response to copper ion starvation
synonyms: cellular response to copper starvation
GO:0035874.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of copper ions.

GO:0035900.name: response to isolation stress

GO:0035900.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a lack of contact with other members of the same species.

GO:0035901.name: cellular response to isolation stress

GO:0035901.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a lack of contact with other members of the same species.

GO:0035902.name: response to immobilization stress

GO:0035902.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of being rendered immobile.

GO:0035903.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of being rendered immobile.

GO:0036110.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of deprivation of inositol.

GO:0036119.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a platelet-derived growth factor stimulus.

GO:0036171.definition: The process in which a group of unicellular organisms grow in a threadlike, filamentous shape in response to a chemical stimulus.

GO:0036180.definition: The process in which a group of unicellular organisms grow in a threadlike, filamentous shape in response to a biotic (living) stimulus.

GO:0070413.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving trehalose that occur as a result of a stimulus indicating the organism is under stress.

synonyms: trehalose metabolic process involved in response to heat stress
GO:0070414.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving trehalose that occur as a result of a heat stimulus, a temperature stimulus above the optimal temperature for that organism.

GO:0070416.name: trehalose metabolism in response to water deprivation
synonyms: trehalose metabolic process involved in response to water deprivation
GO:0070416.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving trehalose that occur as a result of deprivation of water.

GO:0071772.name: response to BMP
synonyms: response to bone morphogenetic protein stimulus
response to BMP stimulus
GO:0071772.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) stimulus.

GO:0071773.name: cellular response to BMP stimulus
synonyms: cellular response to bone morphogenetic protein stimulus
GO:0071773.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a bone morphogenetic protein (BMP) stimulus.

GO:0071774.name: response to fibroblast growth factor

GO:0071774.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a fibroblast growth factor stimulus.

GO:0071935.name: octopamine signaling pathway involved in response to food
synonyms: octopamine signalling pathway involved in response to food
GO:0071935.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of octopamine to a receptor on the surface of the target cell that contributes to a response to a food stimulus.

GO:0048673.name: collateral sprouting of intact axon in response to injury
GO:0048673.definition: The process in which outgrowths develop from the axons of intact undamaged neurons as a result of injury to an axon. The collateral sprouts typically appear from undamaged axons in a tissue which has had part of its nerve supply removed, and they can often innervate successfully any cells that have lost some or all of their original synaptic input.

GO:0048678.name: response to axon injury
GO:0048678.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of an axon injury stimulus.

GO:0080136.name: priming of cellular response to stress
synonyms: priming of stress response
priming of response to stress
GO:0080136.definition: The process that enables cells to respond in a more rapid and robust manner than nonprimed cells to much lower levels of a stimulus indicating the organism is under stress.

GO:0080183.name: response to photooxidative stress
GO:0080183.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as the result of a photooxidative stress, the light-dependent generation of active oxygen species. The process begins with detection of the stimulus and ends with a change in state or activity or the cell or organism.

GO:0097699.name: vascular endothelial cell response to fluid shear stress
synonyms: blood vessel endothelial cell response to fluid shear stress
GO:0097699.definition: Any response to fluid shear stress in a vascular endothelial cell.

GO:0097700.name: vascular endothelial cell response to laminar fluid shear stress
synonyms: blood vessel endothelial cell response to laminar fluid shear stress
GO:0097700.definition: Any response to laminar fluid shear stress in a vascular endothelial cell.

GO:0097701.name: response to pulsatile fluid shear stress
GO:0097701.definition: Any response to fluid shear stress where the fluid is flowing across a solid surface with periodic variations. For example, the endothelium in straight parts of the artery tree is subjected to pulsatile shear stress with a significant forward direction, which is believed to be an important physiological stimulus enhancing vessel compliance and conferring anti-thrombotic, anti-adhesive, and anti-inflammatory effects.

GO:0097702.name: response to oscillatory fluid shear stress
GO:0097702.definition: Any response to fluid shear stress where the fluid is moving across a solid surface with an oscillatory flow. Disturbed flow patterns at the arterial bifurcations and curvatures may cause endothelial dysfunction, which initiates atherosclerosis.

GO:0097703.name: cellular response to pulsatile fluid shear stress
GO:0097703.definition: Any response to pulsatile fluid shear stress that occurs at the level of a cell.

GO:0097704.name: cellular response to oscillatory fluid shear stress
GO:0097704.definition: Any response to oscillatory fluid shear stress that occurs at the level of a cell.

GO:0097705.name: vascular endothelial cell response to pulsatile fluid shear stress
synonyms: blood vessel endothelial cell response to pulsatile fluid shear stress
GO:0097705.definition: Any response to pulsatile fluid shear stress that occurs in a vascular endothelial cell.

GO:0097706.name: vascular endothelial cell response to oscillatory fluid shear stress
synonyms: blood vessel endothelial cell response to oscillatory fluid shear stress
GO:0097706.definition: Any response to oscillatory fluid shear stress that occurs in a vascular endothelial cell.

GO:0098542.name: defense response to other organism

defence response incompatible interaction
defense response, incompatible interaction
GO:0098542.definition: Reactions triggered in response to the presence of another organism that act to protect the cell or organism from damage caused by that organism.

GO:0140039.name: cell-cell adhesion in response to extracellular stimulus

GO:0090664.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or a multicellular organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a higher than normal number of multicellular organisms living per unit area.

GO:0097044.name: histone H3-K56 acetylation in response to DNA damage
GO:0097044.definition: The modification of histone H3 by the addition of an acetyl group to a lysine residue at position 56 of the histone as a result of the detection of DNA damage within a cell.

GO:0097230.name: cell motility in response to potassium ion

GO:0097230.definition: Any process involved in the controlled self-propelled movement of a cell that results in translocation of the cell from one place to another as a result of a potassium ion stimulus.

GO:0097231.name: cell motility in response to calcium ion

GO:0097317.name: invasive growth in response to biotic stimulus
GO:0097317.definition: The growth of colonies in filamentous chains of cells as a result of a biotic stimulus. An example of this is Candida albicans forming invasive filaments in agar medium in response to a serum stimulus.

reactive oxygen species-mediated PCD

GO:1990858.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a lectin stimulus. A lectin is a carbohydrate-binding protein, highly specific for binding sugar moieties.

GO:0038119.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by the binding of the C-C chemokine CCL19 to a C-C chemokine type 7 receptor (CCR7) on the surface of a target cell, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038120.name: CCL21-activated CCR7 signaling pathway
synonyms: CCL21-activated CCR7 signalling pathway
GO:0038120.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by the binding of the C-C chemokine CCL21 to a C-C chemokine type 7 receptor (CCR7) on the surface of a target cell, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038124.name: toll-like receptor TLR6:TLR2 signaling pathway
synonyms: toll-like receptor TLR6:TLR2 signalling pathway
TLR2:TLR6 signaling pathway
GO:0038124.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by a ligand binding of a heterodimeric TLR6:TLR2 complex, followed by transmission of the signal by the activated receptor, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038127.name: ERBB signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB signalling pathway
EGFR family signaling pathway
EGF receptor family signaling pathway
ErbB signaling
GO:0038127.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to a member of the ERBB family of receptor tyrosine kinases on the surface of a cell, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038128.name: ERBB2 signaling pathway
synonyms: HER2 signaling pathway
NEU signaling
receptor tyrosine-protein kinase erbB-2 signaling pathway
ERBB2 signalling pathway
GO:0038128.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to the tyrosine kinase receptor ERBB2 on the surface of a cell. The pathway ends with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription. ERBB2 receptors are themselves unable to bind to ligands, but act as a signal-amplifying tyrosine kinase within a heterodimeric pair.

GO:0038129.name: ERBB3 signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB3 signalling pathway
HER3 signaling pathway
receptor tyrosine-protein kinase erbB-3 signaling pathway
GO:0038129.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to the tyrosine kinase receptor ERBB3 on the surface of a cell, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription. ERBB3 receptors have impaired kinase activity and rely on the kinase activity of the heterodimer partner for activation and signal transmission.

GO:0038130.name: ERBB4 signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB4 signalling pathway
HER4 signaling pathway
receptor tyrosine-protein kinase erbB-4 signaling pathway
GO:0038130.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to the tyrosine kinase receptor ERBB4 on the surface of a cell, and ending with the regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038133.name: ERBB2-ERBB3 signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB2-ERBB3 signalling pathway
HER2-HER3 signaling pathway
GO:0038133.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to a ERBB3 receptor on the surface of a cell, followed by transmission of the signal by a heterodimeric complex of ERBB2 and ERBB3. ERBB2, which does not bind any known ligand, is activated through formation of a heterodimer with another ligand-activated ERBB family member such as ERBB3. ERBB3 also has impaired kinase activity and relies on ERBB2 for activation and signal transmission.

GO:0038134.name: ERBB2-EGFR signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB2-EGFR signalling pathway
EGFR-HER2 signaling pathway
GO:0038134.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to an epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR/ERBB1) on the surface of a cell, followed by transmission of the signal by a heterodimeric complex of ERBB2 and EGFR. ERBB2, which does not bind any known ligand, is activated through formation of a heterodimer with another ligand-activated ERBB family member such as EGFR.

GO:0038135.name: ERBB2-ERBB4 signaling pathway
synonyms: ERBB2-ERBB4 signalling pathway
HER2-HER4 signaling pathway
GO:0038135.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to a ERBB4 receptor on the surface of a cell, followed by transmission of the signal by a heterodimeric complex of ERBB2 and ERBB4. ERBB2, which does not bind any known ligand, is activated through formation of a heterodimer with another ligand-activated ERBB family member such as ERBB4.

GO:0038136.name: ERBB3-ERBB4 signaling pathway
synonyms: HER3-HER4 signaling pathway
ERBB3-ERBB4 signalling pathway
GO:0038136.definition: The series of molecular signals transmitted by a heterodimeric complex of the tyrosine kinase receptors ERBB3 and ERBB4. The pathway begins with binding of a ligand to either cell surface receptor, or the dimeric receptor complex, and ends with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038137.name: ERBB4-EGFR signaling pathway

ERBB4-EGFR signalling pathway
HER1-HER4 signaling pathway
GO:0038137.definition: The series of molecular signals transmitted by a heterodimeric complex of the tyrosine kinase receptors EGFR (epidermal growth factor receptor/ERBB1) and ERBB4. The pathway begins with binding of a ligand to either cell surface receptor, or the dimeric receptor complex, and ends with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

GO:0038138.name: ERBB4-ERBB4 signaling pathway

HER4-HER4 signaling pathway
GO:0038138.definition: The series of molecular signals initiated by binding of a ligand to the tyrosine kinase receptor ERBB4, followed by ligand-induced homodimerization of ERBB4 and transmission of the signal into the cell by the homodimeric ERBB4 complex. The pathway ends with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.
